title: Rumour Mill: Barca eye PL trio to re-build club
text:
Rumour Mill: Barcelona eye Mauricio Pochettino, Ronaldo Koeman or Jurgen Klopp  39pm Source: FOX SPORTS BARCELONA look towards England for Luis Enrique’s successor, Jose ready to rob Arsenal and Isco’s interesting quotes. 
We kick-off your week of football gossip with Monday’s Rumour Mill. 
LOOKING TO ENGLAND 
Luis Enrique’s Barcelona future looks in grave danger of ending, with reports that the Catalan club are looking towards England’s up and coming finest to replenish the club. 
The Daily Express links the La Liga outfit with Mauricio Pochettino , while The Mirror says Jurgen Klopp is their No.1 target. 
Tottenham’s boss has previously quashed talk of Nou Camp being a potential step-up for him, given his time as a player and manager at their local rival Espanyol. However, given the strides he has made at White Hart Lane, his stocks have risen to the point that the Barcelona hot seat is a realistic opportunity for him, despite having recently inked a deal to stay in north London until 2021. Tottenham Hotspur's Argentinian head coach Mauricio Pochettino. Source: AFP 
Barcelona officials were reportedly already ready to move Enrique on, before the debacle in Paris last week. 
Klopp ’s exploits at Borussia Dortmund, as well as Liverpool, have him on a wanted list, which also includes Everton’s Ronald Koeman , should the club opt to go down the route of enlisting a club legend as coach again. Barcelona's coach Luis Enrique (L). Source: AFP 
JOSE READY TO PICK AT ARSENE’S CARCASS 
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain has never quite reached his potential at Arsenal. 
Jose Mourinho wants to help him do so at Manchester United. 
That’s according to The Mirror , which reports that a 30 million pound move for the 23-year-old is being debated at Old Trafford. 
With Michael Carrick’s legs aging, the club is also set to make central midfield a marquee target this summer, with Real Madrid’s Toni Kroos another high profile target, according to reports in The Independent. 
Los Blancos officials are reportedly loathe to lose the German, as United go in again for a player they thought they were about to sign before he moved to Spain from Germany in 2013-2014. Arsenal's midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain. Source: AFP 
ISCO OPENS DOOR TO MOVE 
Perennial Premier League target Isco has dropped a hint that he isn’t completely content at Real Madrid, suggesting he craves more regular game time. 
“I am calm though I am worried about getting more minutes,” he told beIN Sports. 
“I am very happy here but a player’s career is small. Isco (R). Source: AFP 
Meanwhile, the club are now in the queue for 20-year-old Celtic sensation Moussa Dembele, reports The Mirror, joining a host of English suitors, including Manchester City, Chelsea, Arsenal and Liverpool. 
LALLANA STAYING 
The Sun reports that Adam Lallana has finally sealed a £31.2m deal to remain at Liverpool, which will net him £150,000 per week, which will be confirmed by the club at some point this week. Liverpool's German manager Jurgen Klopp (R) embraces Liverpool's English midfielder Adam Lallana.
